column5: Upgrade minor versions for release as well

Return promise from run command function

Fixes #370

Merge pull request #368 from MindTooth/update_travis

- update node version for travis
- remove workaround for travis

Rework .travis.yml to compile & function better

Adding new NodeJS versions is as easy as add to the `env` section.
Add some usage strings for pemssion popups.

Update Copyright and fix 'About' popup.

Apparently a credits file is needed, even if empty.
Remove debug statement and clean up code

Add master stylesheet.

A file named main.css inside the widget dir, will be picked up and
injected as a master style sheet to style all widgets.

Handle Keep-Alive Errors

As an attempt to handle keep-alive errors (Network connection lost):
- bump timeout above 30s, which is the minimum Safari expects
- retry on network errors (required superagent upgrade)

Merge pull request #345 from mprobber/patch-1

[Documentation] Fix a few typos

[Documentation] Fix a few typos

Hey there!
I've been playing around with uebersicht for a while now, cool project! I noticed a few issues with the documentation though.

`export default const refreshFrequency = 1000;` isn't valid javascript, you probably meant `export const refreshFrequency = 1000;`, as well as a typo (`disptach` should be `dispatch`).
Happy holidays!
Update SocketRocket using cocoapods and check for origin for web sockets
Ensure non get requests are from same origin

Increase keep alive timeout

It seems that Safari expects a keep alive timeout of 30s and will throw
tons of 'network connection was lost' errors otherwise.

Stabelize vdom widgets

- using react instead of snabbdom
- added emotion for styling
- improved error handling (sourcemaps + fetching widget implementations
  via script tags)
- updated node modules

Merge pull request #329 from wildeyes/patch-1

Update README.md

Update README.md

Let people know that uebersicht needs node@6 in the README.

Merge pull request #326 from Amorymeltzer/patch-1

UBPreferencesController.xib: Minor typo fix in pref

Merge pull request #325 from lmammino/patch-1

README: Fix missing code style in folder name

Minor typo fix in pref

perserve->preserve
README: Fix missing code style in folder name

Merge pull request #315 from MindTooth/fix_travis

Fix Travis-CI error, temp fix

fixes crash

Cleaning up the webview seems to cause crashes: isOpague is sent to an
already released view.

Pretty sure that removeFromSuperview is the culprit, so it is probably
possible to leave all other cleanups in place. Releasing this as a
hotfix tho.

downgrades esprima

version 3 and 4 have a bug with returning multiline strings
https://github.com/jquery/esprima/issues/1829
fixes redraw of webview for High Sierra
(hopefully) fixes travis by removing temporary extra steps

adds handling of user siwtching.

Apps don't get suspended when user are switched, so any background task,
like the widget server needs to be suspended manually.
Cleaned up server task related code a bit as well.

removes credits for now

Credits are hard to maintain with various people contributing via open
source. Quick fix is to not include credits at all.

adds option to use a login shell for bash commands

Using a login shell by default has proven to be tricky, because peoples
setup can cause warning messages being logged, which garble widget
command output.
However, it is a often requested feature (people expect their locale
and PATH settings to just work), so giving an option to enable it seems
to give the best of both worlds.
fixes virtual dom widget after upgrading snabbdom

disables login shell again

It has been causing issues for people: tools like rvm sometimes print
error messages on every command, which breaks all widgets.

trying fixes travis issue

- installs stable version of nvm before running tests (and downloads the
  necessary gdp key).
- bumps node version

uses mtime to prevent re-rendering

the file watcher often triggers double events. Since it is hard to fix
(and maybe unfixable?), I am using mtime for a cheap check whether we
should re-render a widget.
adds ability to reload a widget via AppleScript
adds ability to refresh a widget via AppleScript
uses a login shell for commands

Merge pull request #265 from hawkrives/travis

Add a TravisCI config

Merge pull request #253 from zuckschwerdt/cors-proxy

Adds CORS proxy

Adding CORS proxy to allow widgets native AJAX access to servers without access-control-allow-origin headers. Bind to loopback, allow only AJAX (Origin request header), and only request origination from Übersicht port.
fixes menu when widget is hidden. Improves code a bit
adds menu item to directly hide widgets

ensures the app doesn't end up with 0 screens

- retrying screen sync when there was an error (or 0 screens).
- 'refresh all widgets' also re-syncs screens

Cleaned up naming and added a ScreenChangeListener protocol as well.

adds compatibility mode

The default window level is desktopLevel again, which fixes Issue #229
and Issue #231 (Übersicht not showing in some cases)

Compatibility mode sets the window level to desktopLevel - 1 for people
who are using other apps that control the desktop (like Path Finder). It
is not a perfect solution yet.

lowers window level

to prevent blocking other desktop apps (fixes Issue #217)

ensures that command function is bound to widget

Fixes Issue #227

Updated to XCode 8 and it's recommened settings.

- this cuts support for 10.9.
- code signing of frameworks now seems to work without a bash script.

WKWebView seems to respect needsDisplay

so we have a slightly nicer way to force a redraw. Still flickers tho.

refactores UBWindow

- all web view logic is split into a separate controller
- fixed regression bugs in load policy

switches to WkWebView

Most things appear to be working. Missing still are

- geolocation
- programatically opening the inspector
adds workaround for widgets relying on process.argv[0]
adds npm prune to build command

takes state out of the CommandLoop.

In fact it just becomes a dumb timer that calls a callback function.
This way, when a widget command or the refresh frequency changes, these
changes trickle down.
not using strict mode in widgetify to not introduce when calling eval
making sure an error can't take the app down
fixes bugs when widgets are removed

Checking modified timestamps to avoid issue with watchify events
triggering twice.
exposing runShellCommand as a client bunlde
quite a rewrite - cleaner and more focused event flow
using a custom fork of watchify that doesnt rely on a broken chokidar
trying to make specs less sensitive to timing issues (closing aall the things)
commands can be plain JS functions
unified state reducers to a single updateProps. Allowing ES7 rest spread
un-DRYed widgets again and fixed error hanldling during render
fixed tranform for legacy js widgets
made widget transform more error proof

Two things:

- correctly wrapping vdom widgets in a domEl
- added ability to map output to props
unified classic and new widget api
using unified command loop for widgets

Merge pull request #199 from paulmwatson/patch-1

Update getting-started.coffee

Merge pull request #193 from gordonmcshane/master

Fix UBWindow issues for Xcode 7.3

Merge pull request #177 from dnicolson/xcode-documentation

Add Xcode build instructions

Correctly setting defaults.

refreshFrequency: false was overridden because I used ||= instead of ?=

Merge pull request #178 from drewvolz/patch-1

Trailing character
only listening to 127.0.0.1 to improve security

Not using strict mode in parseWidget.

It had the undesired side effect that widgets were also parsed in strict
mode.

normalizing all (relevant) filepaths.

Since the same string can have two different byte sequences in unicode,
and JS does not handle this automatically(?) we need to normalize all
file paths in the widget watcher to not end up with same file being
treated as a different widget

Fix for screen monitoring.

CGGetActiveDisplayList already ensures that screens that are mirrored
don't get included.
following symlinks only once in the beginning
still trying to get travis working
one does not simply run specs on osx

Merge pull request #168 from dnicolson/symlink-replacement

Correct filepaths if widget directory is a symlink
Correct filepaths if widget directory is a symlink
re-introduces watching for wp changes again (but not wp server)

Not breaking on server restarts.

This also fixes switching widget dirs
set interaction shortcut to none by default
better error checking for widget dir

Not re-loading webview on screen change.

It looks like it is not necessary and it causes a loading error which
causes the view to load twice.

Not autoreleasing window on close.

It causes crashes when doing so during screen switching. It looks like
the framework holds on to the app's windows and tries to send messages
still.

Also improved cleanup of window content to avoid issues with the
webview.

Deprecated WallpaperSever and cleaned up UBWindow.

It now doesn't subscribe to notications directly anymore.
added simple warning when widgets can't be edited

Selecting individual screens is a single step.

Selecting any of the other screen options will clear selected screens.
using https for updates feed url (sparkle vulnerability)

Using a proper build of SocketRocket.

This fixes code signing issues.

Reworked screen settings:

Can show on all screens, only the main display, or on selected screens
(which can be none). This should cover all use cases.
bug fixes and specs for dir watcher

Moved widget parsing into its own module.

Also made sure that string refresh frequency support is correctly
applied and added specs.
correctly updating widgets on the native side
Specs and bug fixes. Using npm jquery.
Updated test command and cleaned up old test files.

WebSocket ports are not hardcoded anymore.

Using the same port as the HTTP server and using the same fallback
behavior when the port is already in use.
added SocketRocket to the git tree
correctly listening to sleep wake notifications

Fixes in build scripts.

- PATH=$(npm bin):$PATH was unecessary. npm already does that.
- using && instead of ; to get errors

Fixed issue when new widgets trigger a modified event.

Probably has to do with modern editors that will create a file already
before saving it. When the file is then saved by the user, the fs event
is modified instead of created.
removed release node_modules from git tree
reconnecting socket if something goes wrong
split widgets controller into store and actions
using a singleton socket on the Obj C side
using a singleton socket on the JS side

Merge pull request #158 from hawkrives/patch-1

Update link to nib in README

Update link to nib in README

From #157; closes #157.
can update and unhide widgets again

Merge pull request #108 from hawkrives/ms

Allow specifying refreshFrequency as a string (10ms, 5s, etc)

Can send widgets to another screen.

Heavily refactored widget internals. Seperation of internal and public
api is clear now. Not 100% I like it yet.

Merge pull request #155 from d-4-ni/master

Clear timeout on refresh. Fixes #154
can hide and unhide widgets again

Mayor architectual switch.

Using web sockets and a Flux-ish architecture.

Loading client with different screen ids.

Webinspector also works for different screens.
renamed mouseHandler -> keyHandler and using a callback scheme

Encapsulated screen handling in ScreensController.

Formerly known as ScreensMenuController.
Added widgets controller and basic rest client.

Updated npm and release modules.

Using a symlink to package.json to handle release modules now (using npm
install --prodiuction)
widgets appear in the status bar menu
reverted back to having modifier keys

Better detection whether window belongs to Dock.

Checking for windowOwnerName instead of windowName. This makes widgets
clickable when using the 'show desktop' gesture.

Issue #142

Converting forwarded event coordinates to window.

This ensures that clicks also work if the Übersicht window is on a
different screen than the main screen. (Issue #142)

Preventing the context menu to be displayed.

It would show up when ctrl-clicking the desktop as reported in
Issue #141 and Issue #139. It is undesired behavior and there seem to
be no downsides disabling it: all functionality can be accessed using
the main menu anyhow.

Doing a full check whether the window is occluded.

This prevents responding to events when other windows are in front
(oops, Issue #139)

Also forwarding drag events, so that basic drag and drop works again.
Still has glitches, because Desktop selection still gets activated.

Only forwarding events when app is not active.

Seems to prevent some crashes when the inspector or pref pane is open.

Removed interaction shortcut code.

Not needed, since widgets are always clickable now.

Disabeling user select by default.

Prevents glitches since clicking is enabled by default now. Can be
enabled for specific widgets.

Forcing a re-composition on wallpaper change.

This ensures that -webkit-backdrop-filters get refreshed.
Picked a more save identification scheme for the main element as well.

Inspector starts detached by default.

Found a defaults key to conrol this.

Moved screen menu items handling into a controller.
.

Experiment to receive clicks without key shortcut.

Left mouse events are forwarded to the window, which seems to work fine.

Removing status bar item when app terminates.

(Issue #134)

Merge pull request #131 from john-pettigrew/master

Fix typo in readme
build folder was excluded because of xcodes automatic gitignore rule

Merge pull request #103 from hawkrives/symlink-public

Make a symlink from server/release/public to server/src/public
Only run refreshFrequency through ms if it is a string

Merge pull request #99 from ConnorRK/patch-1

Disable rubber-band/overflow scrolling.

Merge pull request #102 from hawkrives/typo

refeshFrequency -> refreshFrequency

Allow specifying refreshFrequency as a string, like '1s' for 1000

It's parsed the the `ms` package on npm.
(https://www.npmjs.com/package/ms)

Make a symlink from server/release/public to server/src/public

When the server is run from coffeescript, it expects to find the public
dir in the cwd. This makes such a folder exist.

Disable rubber-band/overflow scrolling.

Prevents the user from scrolling past the screen causing it to snap back to frame when released.
Fixes/improvements for geolocation. Bumped version to 0.5.17

New command runner implementation.

Using spawn instead of exec and streaming the output directly to the
http response. This should be more efficient and avoids buffer limits
for large command output.

Merge branch 'master' into geolocation

Conflicts:
	Uebersicht/UBWindow.m
fixed webDelegate logic to allow loading of iframes
not starting/stopping widget when already stopped
getting closer to a complete geolocation api
first working step towards exposiing a geolocation api
Recovery and cleanups. More work on widget api.

Widget changes

- exposing full api to widget implementations
- added cache busters and timeout for command requests
- refresh frequency can be set to false in which case command is not
  required anymore

more robust url parsing in command server.

This will allow for appending cache busters
preventing navigation away from widgets page
removed node modules from git tree

Wallpaper server improvements.

Not closing clients upon new requests and added extra checks to avoid
crashes.
The client now only requests the wp if bgSlices are actually set.

Added delete widget for new file watcher

Storing the original file path on widgets to make this a lot easier.

removed chokidar and falling back on bare fsevents

Also upgraded localnode

Merge branch 'master' into better-file-watcher

Also installed newest chokidar to resolve conflict.

Conflicts:
	server/node_modules/chokidar/node_modules/fsevents/.npmignore
added option to configure the interaction key shortcut
disabled checking for actual wallpaper changes for now

loading scripts from widgets should work now

Conflicts:
	server/node_modules/chokidar/node_modules/fsevents/.npmignore
	server/release/public/main.js
	server/release/server.js
no more version checking (behaviour is the same on Mavericks it seems)
loading scripts from widgets should work now
ignoring errors when widget has been deleted
not setting resource load delegate anymore

More wallpaper server improvements.

- making sure server is started
- removed debug statements
less aggressive come to front behaviour
avoiding memory leaks by not storing wallpaper slices

Improvements to wallpaper server (Issue #42).

- Detecting wallpaper changes by listening to file changes to settings db.
- Rapid changes are batched together.
- Wallaper urls are uniq per change.
- Renamed wallaperDataUrl to wallpaperUrl

Using policy delegate instead of load delegate.

Opening links seems to work fine now (Issue #12)
better checks for load delegation. Not quite happy yet

Wallpaper is loaded directly instead of data-url.

Needed to revise loading policy for that as well.
moved wallaper handling to seperate object
using a modifier key instad of a configurable shortcut

Merge branch 'master' into interaction-shortcut

Conflicts:
	Übersicht/UBPreferencesController.xib
increased buffer size for widget commands

Not failing if  default port is in use.

Checking 10 other ports before giving up.
Refactord the server task to use the more modern block syntax.

Added website link to readme.

Issue #31

Also added syntax highlighting.
named build phases and set SDK to 10.9 (crashes on Mavericks otherwise)
reloading webview when something goes wrong
added menu item to visit widget gallery (Issue #28)
status bar icon works with 10.10 dark mode
added build step to compile js
completely reloading client when someting goes wrong
actually initializing max_displays might be a good idea

Merge branch 'screen-control' into refresh-button

Conflicts:
	Übersicht/UBAppDelegate.m

Small improvements and fixes.

Using a constant instead of hard coded number for the max number of
screens.
Making sure some vars are initialized to nil and not garbage.
Merge branch 'screen-control' of github.com:felixhageloh/uebersicht into screen-control

Merge pull request #21 from gboudreau/screen-control

Remember preferred screens, when user selects one from the menu.
better naming for displays with duplicate names
better naming for displays with duplicate names

Merge branch 'screen-control' into refresh-button

Conflicts:
	Übersicht/UBAppDelegate.m
fixed wallpaper coordinates for multi screen setups

Added refresh menu item to reload all widgets.

As requested in Issue #12
fixed framework search paths. code signing still broken on 10.10
getting screen names the non deprecated way

Fixed issue with incorrect screen being marked.

Also refactored a bit for clarity
quick fix for wigets with spaces in their name
text formating change for displays in menu

Merge pull request #19 from gboudreau/screen-control

Use display names in the menu, instead of just numbers
making sure wallpaper is refreshed on screen change
switching to Quartz since NSScreen is unreliable as !*@#&^

Merge branch 'wallpaper'

Conflicts:
	Übersicht/UBAppDelegate.m
	Übersicht/UBWindow.m
	server/release/public/main.js
	server/release/server.js
	server/spec/frontend_specs.js
yeah well, it actually kinda is
listening to window close events is not necessary anymore

Fixed Issue #4 with debug console.

Using frame change notification to detect whether the web inspector is
attached to the main view. Using this to control the window level.

More improvements in error logging.

- passing stylus errors to frontend as well. Line numbers are off but
  that will be hard to fix.
- logging widget render errors to console as well. Trying to print a bit
  more useful information there
- using error.toString accross the board when possible

Improvements for relaying error to the client.

- fixed issues when changes and errors occure in succesion.
- errors are plain strings
- improved error messages
working relaying backend errors to the client

Added link to coffeescript website to readme.

Fixes #10
trying to fix code signing issues on 10.10

Refactorings and fixes in os_bridge.

Cleaned up loading callbacks and improved loading logic. Re-using the
same image for caching.

Fixes and improvements for wallpaper service.

Pluged memory leak. Only notifiying wallpaper change when it actually
did.
added afterRender hook. cleanups and specs
working on getting wallpaper change notifications.
finished refactoring and exposing wallpaper url to webview
refactored UBWindow to be in control of the main view
removed debug statements. added some documentation

Merge pull request #1 from siemensikkema/patch-1

fix typos
making sure widget dir stays selected when user presses cancel
split server out from binary and added integration specs
tweaked icon a bit. Not quite there yet
some tweaks and comments for changes server

Batching changes together.

Also removed timeout in client to make sure none are lost
removed multi-party, an unused depenecy of connect
widgets can recover from errors. Upgraded sinon.js
making sure widget ids are correctly derived
Using 64bit nodejs again, but the official binary.
